meanings.definition: The action of accusing someone of being a communist or sympathetic to communism.
meanings.sent1: The redbaiting of the politician caused a lot of controversy.
meanings.sent2: Redbaiting was a common tactic during the Cold War.
meanings.sent3: The redbaiting in the movie made the audience gasp in shock.
meanings.sent4: Her redbaiting of her opponent was like throwing fuel on the fire.
meanings.sent5: The redbaiting in the courtroom was so intense, you could cut the tension with a knife.

meanings.definition: The act of using fear or suspicion of communism to discredit someone or their ideas.
meanings.sent1: The politician's redbaiting of his rival backfired spectacularly.
meanings.sent2: Redbaiting can be a harmful political strategy.
meanings.sent3: The redbaiting at the debate was so obvious, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: Her redbaiting of the journalist was like a dark cloud hanging over the press conference.
meanings.sent5: The redbaiting in the campaign ad was so blatant, it left a lasting impression on voters.
